title: MACOA's International Tasting
content:
We will represent South Korea and serve Kimbap as our national dish. Also, do not miss our very own Minyeong Kim, give her first United States performance of Korean traditional dance during the event!

The International Tasting will be at Southern Homes and Garden on Vaughn Road, from 2pm until 4 pm on November 11, 2018.

Come out and visit our table to learn more exciting news about the upcoming Korean Cultural Experience and more!

Tagged community, food, dance

title: Korean Cultural Experience - Montgomery
content: 2019’s Korean Cultural Experience presents A Korean Cinderella Story. This performance puts an Eastern twist on a classic tale and highlights the interaction between humans and nature. Audiences will be treated to elements of traditional Korean folklore, dance and music in this comedy showcase.

title: Korean Cultural Experience - Matinee
content:
2019’s Korean Cultural Experience presents A Korean Cinderella Story. This performance puts an Eastern twist on a classic tale and highlights the interaction between humans and nature. Audiences will be treated to elements of traditional Korean folklore, dance and music in this comedy showcase.

The matinee honors active and retired service members, seniors and students with half priced tickets.

title: Make N Take (Cultural Expression through Art)
content:
The theme of the Make N Take cultural arts event is cultural bridge building. As an organization, A-KEEP’s primary mission is to provide multicultural diversity education programs to the students and professionals of both Alabama and Korea.
Art is universal and relevant regardless of cultural background. It is also a wonderful way to express one’s culture pride and history. It is our hope that through this event we can use art to bridge cultural differences as well as educate members of the community about the cultures represented at this event. Attendees can also express their own culture through the different artistic mediums available at this event.
This event is created in partnership with A-KEEP’s Bridge of Unity in Diversity (BUD) Club. This youth leadership group focuses on educating the community about developmental disabilities. Not only is this event an opportunity to educate attendees about multicultural art, but it is also an opportunity for the BUD Club to educate the community about developmental disabilities.
We want families of and attendees with disabilities to participate in this event and be a part of educating those in attendance about disabilities through visibility. By being there, participating, learning, and being able to take the art they make home we hope all who are in attendance will leave with the ability to educate others about a culture and disabilities.
The Make n Take Arts Event is open only to children and their families, and is free.of charge.
For more information, contact Nethra Param at nethra.param@akeep.org or through (334) 625-8515.
Posted in Art

title: Passport to Culture
content:
Passport to Culture is a fundraiser to illuminate and celebrate some of the wonderful cultures that have impacted our communities and local economy. It is a chance to celebrate cultural diversity, engage more members of the community.
Enjoy a night of performances relevant to the wonderful cultures of Alabama.
Partake of our culturally inspired dinner.
Learn about diverse peoples at our artist info booths.
The Passport to Culture event is organized by the Alabama-Korea Education and Economic Partnership, an IRS certified 501c3 non-profit organization whose mission is to provide and facilitate multicultural diversity education to bridge the differences between Alabama and Korea for local economic prosperity. Funds from the Passport to Culture will go towards supporting A-KEEP’s programs which are offered freely or at low cost to the community so that everyone has the opportunity to benefit from multicultural learning and advanced opportunities.
Tickets for this fundraiser are $10 per attendee (plus fees if purchased online) and can be purchased on our Passport to Culture Facebook event page or at the door on the day of the event. Tickets and seating are limited!

title: Open Auditions A Tale of Two Brothers
content:
The Alabama-Korea Education and Economic Partnership (A-KEEP) invites our community to open auditions for amateur actors and actresses, dancers, stagehands and support staff to participate in the our 5th annual Korean Cultural Experience (KCE) musical performance of A Tale of Two Brothers. Auditions, open to all ages, will be held on Sunday, March 1st at 2 pm and Tuesday, March 3rd at 6:30 pm at the Alabama Christian Academy chorus room.
Auditioning actors, actresses, and dancers will participate by reading from a provided script, learn and perform a short movement piece, and they should prepare 16-bars of a song to sing. Korean speaking skills are not required to audition.

A Tale of Two Brothers is a musical play based on the Korean folktale of Heungbu and Nolbu. The story is adapted from both Korean and Alabamian culture to bring a new perspective to a well-known tale while drawing upon local folklore and traditions. This community-based musical theater production will challenge Alabamians to become bridges of cultures between local migrant Korean and Alabamians communities under the direction of a local professional director and playwright, Dr. Angela Dickson and Korean professional dance instructor, Hyunju “Bella” Shim.

Thanks to funding from the National Endowment of the Arts, the Alabama State Council on the Arts, and the Alabama Commission on Higher Education, the program will push high-quality and multicultural learning to move audience members from being bystanders to partakers in bridging cultural arts between Alabama and Korea. A-KEEP’s mission is to provide multicultural diversity education programs to the students and professionals of both Alabama and Korea. A-KEEP also serves the community as a global partnership facilitator by bridging the differences between institutions and corporations of Alabama and Korea for local economic prosperity. Our annual KCE provides community enrichment and multicultural experiences to local people.
